level.introtext: Sometimes you want to run code many times. Introducing the use of loops!
level.endtext: Sweet! Now you know about loops!
level.code:
FOR loops run for a fixed number of iterations. In Python they run through an iterable datatype. Range produces a list of numbers from 0 to the parameter. Range can also take a starting index. The variable will be each value in the iterable till it runs out of items.
This loop will be identical to the last level's! for j in range(3): print("This loop has run, j, "times!")
